alert.note: Alert for Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Pueblo Vicinity, Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 4:43PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern El Paso and north central Pueblo Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 439 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong heavy rain producing thunderstorm near Pinon, or 12 miles north of Pueblo. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall, winds in excess of 30 mph and brief pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Localized ponding of water on roads will be possible and poor visibility under heavy downpours can be expected. Localized flooding will be possible if this storm maintains strength. Locations impacted include... Extreme north side of Pueblo West and Pinon MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Pueblo Vicinity, Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet
